data.text: @PJACaytonPhD Hello Prof. Are we testing enough? I got busy and lost track.
@PJACaytonPhD So no more daily data for number of cases? Why?  it serves as a deterrent and to remind people Covid is still around

Sadly, with the new data release scheme by DOH, it may be difficult to timely determine that.

3/3

We don't still know the impact of shifting to Alert Level 1 until after a few weeks or maybe the end of the month, but it is expected that it may push Rt closer to 1 than before but still hoping less than 1.

2/3

Opinion:

Around the start of Feb, there was a slight incline in Rt from the 0.6 range to 0.79-0.82 range but still below 1, meaning a slight slowdown in the decline of case. It coincides with the loosening to Alert Level 2 in NCR.

1/3

Based on https://t.co/YNNuiv8IPg, using recent 180 days of data as of March 6, 2022, & adjusted to DOH reporting delays noted as of Jan 15, 2022.

Bec. the method involves Bayesian stats, the intervals indicate the range w/ 90% prob. based on assumed model & summarized data.

Terms:

Mean = Expected number of new cases for the date.
SD = Prediction standard error
Lower_90 = Lower 90% credible interval
Upper_90 = Upper 90% credible interval
